meanings.definition: To repair or renovate (a ship, building, etc.)
meanings.sent1: The crew refits the old ship with new sails.
meanings.sent2: He refits his house every few years to keep it in good condition.
meanings.sent3: The pirates decided to refit their ship with a disco ball for fun.
meanings.sent4: She refits her wardrobe with trendy clothes to stay fashionable.
meanings.sent5: Refits can make old things look brand new again.

meanings.definition: The act of repairing or renovating something.
meanings.sent1: The refits on the building made it look like new.
meanings.sent2: The refits of the ship were completed ahead of schedule.
meanings.sent3: The refits of the house turned it into a cozy retreat.
meanings.sent4: The refits of the car gave it a sleek and modern appearance.
meanings.sent5: The refits transformed the old structure into a modern marvel.
